name: Cognitive Behavioral Training
description: Training to develop self-awareness, recognize cognitive distortions, and apply techniques for psychological resilience.

cards.title: Identifying Cognitive Distortions
cards.description: Recognizing and categorizing common distortions in thinking that lead to emotional distress.
bulletpoints: Understanding common distortions: black-and-white thinking, catastrophizing, and overgeneralization.
Tracking personal cognitive distortions in daily thoughts.
Developing awareness of when distortions impact decision-making.

cards.title: Thought Replacement Techniques
cards.description: Replacing negative and irrational thoughts with constructive and logical ones.
bulletpoints: Practicing reframing techniques for negative experiences.
Challenging irrational beliefs through evidence-based questioning.
Using counter-scripting to create positive mental scripts.

cards.title: Mindfulness-Based Cognitive Training
cards.description: Using mindfulness to observe thoughts and emotions without immediate reaction.
bulletpoints: Practicing detachment from intrusive thoughts.
Developing present-moment awareness through mindfulness exercises.
Applying mindfulness-based stress reduction (MBSR) techniques.

cards.title: Behavioral Activation Strategies
cards.description: Using intentional behaviors to shift emotional states and counteract negative thought patterns.
bulletpoints: Engaging in activities that challenge depressive or anxious cycles.
Setting incremental goals to build a positive behavioral routine.
Applying activation techniques to counter learned helplessness.

cards.title: Cognitive Defusion Techniques
cards.description: Distancing oneself from distressing thoughts to reduce their emotional impact.
bulletpoints: Practicing verbal defusion techniques to weaken negative self-talk.
Using visualization to create emotional separation from harmful thoughts.
Employing humor as a tool for reframing and neutralizing mental stress.

cards.title: Restructuring Negative Core Beliefs
cards.description: Identifying and modifying deeply ingrained negative beliefs about oneself and the world.
bulletpoints: Tracing the origins of limiting core beliefs.
Applying logical analysis to challenge faulty belief systems.
Reinforcing healthier beliefs through evidence-based affirmations.

cards.title: Adaptive Exposure Therapy
cards.description: Gradual exposure to stressors to build resilience and desensitize emotional triggers.
bulletpoints: Systematic desensitization for anxiety-related responses.
Creating controlled exposure scenarios for emotional adaptation.
Using graded exposure techniques to increase tolerance to psychological discomfort.

cards.title: Cognitive Flexibility Training
cards.description: Enhancing the ability to shift thinking patterns and adapt to new perspectives.
bulletpoints: Practicing lateral thinking to generate alternative solutions.
Using paradoxical thinking to challenge rigid mental frameworks.
Applying multi-perspective analysis to counter cognitive rigidity.

cards.title: Self-Talk and Mental Conditioning
cards.description: Developing a positive and constructive internal dialogue.
bulletpoints: Using affirmation scripting to reinforce psychological strength.
Practicing metacognition to observe and regulate self-talk.
Replacing defeatist language with constructive internal messaging.

cards.title: Long-Term Cognitive Maintenance
cards.description: Implementing daily cognitive strategies for sustained emotional and mental resilience.
bulletpoints: Building consistent habits for self-reflection and cognitive restructuring.
Tracking cognitive progress through journaling and self-assessment.
Engaging in lifelong learning to reinforce cognitive adaptability.
